metadata.title: CVE-2023-37202 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.description:
Cross-compartment wrappers wrapping a scripted proxy could have causedobjects from other compartments to be stored in the main compartmentresulting in a use-after-free. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 115,Firefox ESR < 102.13, and Thunderbird < 102.13.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-37202` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:102.13.0+build1-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.13.0+build1-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.13.0+build1-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.13.0+build1-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.13.0+build1-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.13.0+build1-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
No subscription required

libmozjs-102-0 - 102.13.0-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:102.13.0+build1-0ubuntu0.23.04.1').
mozjs78 package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs102 package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '102.13.0-0ubuntu0.23.04.1').
